website_summaries.verdict: A high-end construction site radio that is cordless and simple to use.
pros: Comes with built-in clock and 15 presets
AM and FM radio can be connected to satellite radio, CD player, or other devices
Equipped with flexible antenna designed to deliver strong radio signal
cons: More distortion and white noise compared to similar radios

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt Never Disappoints
customer_reviews.text: My husband owns a construction company and while he takes great care of his tools and belongings he sometimes has employees that fail to do the same. He has had this stereo for almost 6 years now- and plays like a newer quality stereo that you would go out and purchase today. The ability to use it to charge items and plug other items in was certainly a plus. The accessibility of a docking station when your in the middle of nowhere or the radio is merely talk shows at too early am was a selling point and is used frequently. Dewalt never disappoints.
customer_reviews.author: Cupcake Lady

customer_reviews.title: Works great and can take some abuse.
customer_reviews.text: This will charge the battery and let you listen to the radio on battery power or you can plug it into the wall. Radio performed well and can take the abuse of the job site. If the clock and preset stations don't hold their settings you will have to replace a small watch battery inside the main battery compartment which runs the LED screen.

customer_reviews.title: Great for work and play

Yet if you are really blasting the music then it will only last a few hours. NOTE: that is with an 18 volt battery. The base isn’t anything to get excited about; I typically have it turned off. I would be careful of the small connector port for the ipod or other music source because it is a fragile point and can be easily damaged. But for a rugged radio/amplifier in your truck, battery operated, it fits the bill.
